author: Staff Reporter
text:
To identify manual scavengers involved in cleaning human excreta in an insanitary latrine or in an open drain, the City Municipal Corporation would be conducting survey between February 22 and 24 in the corporation limits.

No credible data

With no credible data available on the number of manual scavengers, the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment has decided to identify them and their family members so as to work on rehabilitation measures as per the Prohibition of Employment as Manual Scavengers and their Rehabilitation Act, 2013.

According to the 2011 Census, the number of households in the corporation has been identified as 2,15,314. Of this 1,61,774 households have latrine facility within the premises while 29,435 dispose the night soil into open drain. Manual scavengers were involved in removing human excreta in 133 households in the corporation limits. Since all the scavengers were not covered in the previous survey, the ministry has asked the civic bodies to conduct survey to identify them.

Those engaged or employed for manually cleaning, disposing or handling human excreta in an insanitary latrine or in an open drain or pit or a railway tracks would be covered in the survey.

Zones

Survey would be done in all the zones and they were asked to contact M. Sekar (99763-92560) for Suramangalam Zone, M. Kandasamy (99424-76587) for Hasthampatti Zone, T. Venkadachalam (90953-69369) for Ammapet Zone and M. Manikandan (99763-92560) for Kondalampatti Zone.

The public were also asked to inform the scavengers to contact the officials and submit their details for rehabilitation.
title: Survey of manual scavengers from February 22
